name: Epicenter
long_description:
We're building a suite of open-source, local-first apps that share a single memory—so your ideas, plans, and code live in one connected space. Most tools divide you: one for notes, one for tasks, one for contacts. Epicenter is designed to blur those lines—so you can stay in flow across disciplines.

We’ve started with tools like Whispering (a fast, local transcription tool) and epicenter.sh (a way to talk to a folder on your computer). But this is just the beginning. We're building a plain-text-native ecosystem: a text editor, chat, a personal assistant, and more—designed to work together out of the box, and run on your own machine.

If you’re tired of switching apps to finish a thought—or of vendors owning your memory—Epicenter might feel like home.
one_liner: All your tools—transcription, chat, writing—sharing one local,…
